description: Students explore one or more periods, genres, or topics of Spanish literature from its
beginnings to the 21st century.  Selected literary works are analyzed within their
socio-historical and cultural contexts and in reference to pertinent critical or
theoretical issues.  Sample topics include: Sin and the Church in Medieval Literature,
The Stage as Political Propaganda in Imperial Spain, and Federico Garc√≠a Lorca: Voices of
the Oppressed.  May be repeated if topic is different.  Taught in Spanish. Offered annually.
shortname: Top: What is a Meaningful Life?
